perturbation.explanation: This modification mandates payment only one day before shipment. Given the complexities of international wire transfers, a single day is highly impractical and unreasonable. Wire transfers, especially across borders, can often take several business days to process. Demanding payment one day before shipment creates a high risk of late payment and could lead to breach of contract. This contradicts reasonable business practices and may violate the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing.
